intro: Centaurium pulchellum var. tenuiflorum, commonly known as slenderflower narrowleaf centaury, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or red, with five petals, and are arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It blooms from late spring to early summer and is characterized by its delicate, herbaceous appearance.
